title: Father John Misty's 'Pure Comedy' is a Hilarious Masterpiece
summary: Pure Comedy is almost 50 minutes long and features 16 tracks. Most of the songs are soft and easy-going, almost like a lullaby. The album title is such a bold statement that it serves as a perfect introduction to the record. There are a lot of serious moments throughout the album, and one of the most poignant is Lonely-Ass Eden. The darkest moment is When the Comedyâ€™s Over, which is perhaps the darkest moment on the album. It is both humorous and chilling and perfectly captures the tone of the album as well as the tone.

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"A Comedy of Errors"),mdx("p",null,"Humor is always a tricky thing to discuss, but it\u2019s especially difficult to pin down in music, since it\u2019s so subjective. Everyone has their own idea of what is and isn\u2019t humorous in music, and honestly, that\u2019s what makes it great. With that in mind, we want to start by saying that Pure Comedy is an album full of hilarious moments. There are a lot of ridiculous scenarios painted throughout this record, many of which are undoubtedly hilarious in their absurdity."),mdx("p",null,"That being said, we think the most humorous aspect of Pure Comedy is the fact that Tillman named the album Pure Comedy. The title is just so ridiculous and over-the-top; it\u2019s the comedic equivalent of naming a movie The Greatest Film Ever Made. The album title is such a bold statement that it again serves as a perfect introduction to this record. It\u2019s so silly and over-the-top that it\u2019s impossible not to laugh."),mdx("h2",null,"The Art of Idling"),mdx("p",null,"Throughout the record, Tillman is also critical of the way people spend their time. While the tracklist paints a picture of the human race as a group of anxious, fearful beings, the music itself is often quite soothing. Most of the songs are soft and easy-going, almost like a lullaby. We\u2019re not saying that lulling oneself to sleep is a bad thing, but there\u2019s also nothing particularly productive about simply idling away one\u2019s time."),mdx("p",null,"There\u2019s also a strong element of irony to the way Pure Comedy is constructed. The record is almost 50 minutes long and features 16 tracks, so it\u2019s definitely not short. Yet, many of these songs are rather easy-going and lack the intensity one might expect from a record this long. In this way, the album almost feels like a satire of the way pop music is constructed."),mdx("h2",null,"Hangout at the End of the World"),mdx("p",null,"Humans are an anxious bunch, and a large part of that anxiety stems from the way we consume our news. We\u2019re constantly being fed information about what is happening in the world and being asked to react to it, but what if we don\u2019t have the time or energy to process it all? What if we\u2019re just too busy dealing with our own personal problems to care about the next election or refugee crisis?"),mdx("p",null,"This is the sentiment explored in Hangout at the End of the World. It\u2019s a tongue-in-cheek song that uses some exaggerated imagery to explore the idea that we all just need to calm down and relax a bit. It\u2019s a message that is as relevant today as it was when the song was written."),mdx("h2",null,"Just a Normal Day"),mdx("p",null,"On the other end of the spectrum, Just a Normal Day is a satirical take on the idealistic way we view our lives. We often look back on past days and wish we could be living in that moment again, but the truth is that most days are normal and average."),mdx("p",null,"The lyrics to Just a Normal Day paint a picture of a day that is so ordinary, so normal, that it\u2019s almost boring. On paper, it\u2019s not a particularly interesting or special day, but Tillman makes us wish we could experience it for ourselves. He makes us wish we could have a day that is so mundane and normal because there\u2019s nothing better than a normal day."),mdx("h2",null,"Lonely-Ass Eden"),mdx("p",null,"While the tracklist of Pure Comedy is littered with humorous moments, there are also a lot of serious themes explored here. People are not just idling away their time; they\u2019re also consumed with fear and anxiety. There are a lot of serious moments throughout the album, and one of the most poignant is Lonely-Ass Eden."),mdx("p",null,"This is the sort of song that is as much about what is said as it is about what is not said. There are a lot of general statements and vague references made, but there\u2019s also a distinct lack of specifics. This song is as much about what it doesn\u2019t say as it is about what it does say, and we think that\u2019s very clever."),mdx("h2",null,"When the Comedy\u2019s Over"),mdx("p",null,"Finally, Tillman ends the record with the track When the Comedy\u2019s Over, which is perhaps the darkest moment on the album. This song talks about the way we perceive the universe and how we\u2019re all trapped in our own bubbles. It\u2019s a cynical take on the universe that again uses imagery that is both funny and a bit frightening."),mdx("p",null,"This song is definitely the most dramatic moment on Pure Comedy, and it\u2019s a great way to wrap up the record. It\u2019s both humorous and chilling, and it perfectly captures the tone of the album as a whole."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"To put it simply, Father John Misty\u2019s new record, Pure Comedy, is a hilarious masterpiece. It\u2019s a record that manages to be funny and depressing all at once, which is a really difficult thing to do. The album is beautifully constructed and masterfully written, and it\u2019s an easy contender for the best album of 2017. If you\u2019re not laughing, you\u2019re probably crying, and that\u2019s precisely the effect Father John Misty intended."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Grapes of Wrath" Is a Classic of American Literature
9 of the Best Hip Hop Songs for Your Next Workout
"Birdman" Is a Darkly Comic Meditation on Fame and Ego
Chvrches' 'Love Is Dead' Is a Pop Gem

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s musical landscape, popular electronic music has taken over the pop world. But there are still some great pop albums that aren\u2019t filled with auto-tune and EDM drops.On May 25th, the Scottish band Chvrches released their third album called \u201C Love is Dead.\u201D The synth-pop band has lots of happy vibes and catchy hooks on their new album. It\u2019s a pleasant listen but might not be what you expect if you only know them from their first two albums. The band took a left turn creatively, covering topics like technology, isolation and death rather than dancing around in your bedroom to this record.
Chvrses has gained more popularity among a different group of fans by releasing this album than they ever did with their first two releases combined. This is partially because they have expanded their audience by collaborating on songs with Haim and Bleachers recently as well as making this change in sound so now they have crossover appeal to radio listeners too!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Bridge of Spies" Is a Masterful Cold War Thriller

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`With the specter of mutually assured destruction looming over every global crisis and proxy conflict, the Cold War is perhaps one of the most fraught periods in history. There are no heroes in this period\u2014just two paranoid superpowers scrambling to maintain the upper hand, irrespective of cost. The inherent darkness and moral ambiguity of that period makes for fantastic fodder for any storyteller looking to immerse their audience in a stark world where there are no easy answers.
The 1980s was a peak moment in that tension\u2014from Reagan\u2019s \u201Cevil empire\u201D speech and constant saber-rattling, to the U.S.-backed Contra War against Communist rebels in Nicaragua and an escalation of tensions between NATO and the USSR all around the globe. In brief: It was not a good time to be alive if you believed in world peace. Thankfully, Hollywood had spies as intrepid as Tom Hanks ready to leap into action against those dastardly Soviet Commies whenever they needed someone captured or rescued from behind enemy lines.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Big Short" Is a Searing Indictment of the Financial Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The film version of The Big Short hits theaters this Friday, and it\u2019s not subtle. Its tagline is \u201CThere\u2019s a sucker born every minute. But they don\u2019t grow up thinking they can be con men. They get taught to be one.\u201D And its trailer goes on to say, \u201CThe housing bubble was about to burst\u2026 And a group of misfits saw it coming. Now these unlikely heroes must band together and bring down the greedy villains who crashed the world economy\u2026 Before anyone else gets hurt.\u201D
Unfortunately, that last part is not hyperbole. The actions of unscrupulous financial engineers \u2014 colloquially known as \u201Cbankers\u201D \u2014 led directly to the Great Recession in 2008, which cost millions their jobs and homes, while triggering widespread deflation and anemic growth throughout much of the developed world for years thereafter.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' Is a Solid Effort

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Charlie Puth has been on a roll lately, with three top 40 hits in the last two years. He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Hateful Eight" Is a Quentin Tarantino Tour De Force
"The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The History of Hip Hop Music: The Influential Years

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Hip hop music is a universal language. It has proven to be a way for people from different cultures and backgrounds to come together and express themselves. From its humble beginnings in New York City, hip hop has grown into a worldwide sensation, with local scenes spawning in cities across the globe. This article explores the history of hip-hop music, from its roots as an underground movement in the early 1980s to its predominance as one of the most popular genres today.
Fans of rap music are undoubtedly aware that this style of music has origins in New York City during the 1970s and 1980s, but there is much more to know about how exactly it came about and how it evolved over time. From breakdancing to rapping, we\u2019ll explore all of the elements that blended together to form what we now call \u201Chip-hop\u201D today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
